title: Thunderbird - I accidentally deleted my saved login
creator: beach_boy_dave
content: When made to change my password by my email provider, instead of deleting my old password in Thunderbird I accidentally deleted the entire saved login (Thunderbird > Settings > Privacy&Security > Passwords > Saved Passwords > then deleted the entire saved login instead of only deleting the old password). When I tried adding my account login back to Thunderbird using “+ New Account”, it gives me an error message that my incoming server already exists. I'm trying to get my old saved login back without doing any more harm. I can still get into Thunderbird but it won't connect to the server (my login credentials now fail). I can still see and read my old emails but it won't retrieve any new emails. Is there a way to get my old login credentials back or re-enter them into Thunderbird? If not, are there files and folders I can copy from my old saved Thunderbird Profile directory into my active Profile directory to be able to login to my account again while keeping my local folders? I saved a lot of my email to my local folders, so I'm hesitant to overwrite my Mail folder (and even my ImapMail folder) for fear of losing my existing folders, especially my local folders.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:144.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/144.0;solver_id:7146899

title: '''T-Bird one Yahoo of six accts, repetitive “ENTER CREDENTIALS” on my desktop ONLY. EDGE: Too many requests (bug1997062)
creator: TedT_USA
content:
T-Bird one Yahoo of six accts, repetitive “ENTER CREDENTIALS” My T-bird release: 144.0.1 (64-bit) Desktop: WIN 11 Pro – with all updates

For the last few days, I have not been able to obtain emails on my desktop T-Bird for one of my six Yahoo accounts. And, I cannot send any emails from the account

BUT, I can access the target Yahoo email account via my desktop Firefox, via Android T-Bird and via Android/Firefox. And all incoming and outgoing emails are present. Stymied, I changed the Yahoo acct password. After the change, these three work domains perfectly as before. And again, all incoming and outgoing emails are present.

BUT, the repetitive error with my desktop T-Bird for the one Yahoo account persists. The POP-UP provides a long string in the URL window and the only text shows: “Edge: Too Many Requests” >>>>>>>> I’m not using EDGE [Yahoo must use EDGE for the login error POP-UP] The window in the bottom Task Bar displays: “Enter credentials” [repetitively – ad nauseum].

This is the copy of the Yahoo URL in the POP-UP: https://login.yahoo.com/?src=thunderbird&client_id=dj0yJmk9NUtCTWFMNVpTaVJmJmQ9WVdrOVJ6UjVTa2xJTXpRbWNHbzlNQS0tJnM9Y29uc3VtZXJzZWNyZXQmeD0yYw--&crumb=mdAGY49jGd8&login_hint=name_of_email_acct%40yahoo.com&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost&pspid=954010027&activity=thunderbird-imap&done=https%3A%2F%2Fapi.login.yahoo.com%2Foauth2%2Fauthorize%3F.scrumb%3D0%26client_id%3Ddj0yJmk9NUtCTWFMNVpTaVJmJmQ9WVdrOVJ6UjVTa2xJTXpRbWNHbzlNQS0tJnM9Y29uc3VtZXJzZWNyZXQmeD0yYw--%26redirect_uri%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Flocalhost%26response_type%3Dcode%26scope%3Dmail-w I changed my email account name in the display above to: name_of_email_acct; all else is verbatim.

For clarity all six accounts work without encountering "Enter credentials" on the desktop via Firefox, my android via T-Bird app, my android via Firefox. Five of the six work on my desktop T-bird.

I did not add any extensions in the last week. I did disable all extensions (and restarted) with no change in behavior. I put a 25 cent piece on the keyboard to appease the computer gods – no change.

Yup: cleared cache and cookies. Deleted password from desktop T-Bird repository, but the new one is not recorded. Changed authentication from OAuth2 to Normal and back again- no change

Yes, I waited multiple hours to try again, with no luck.

Thoughts ????
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:144.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/144.0

title: How to fix Thunderbird tiny scroll bars, on Linux (Zorin Pro)
creator: DD46
content:
Hi,

I've read some of the support topics about the super narrow scroll bars in Thunderbird. I did go to: https://www.reddit.com/r/Thunderbird/comments/1fz9f5j/comment/lr02b8z/

which was suggested. I did the fix, which helped one problem (the super narrow scroll bar size), but there are no up & down arrows on the scroll bar. This was a really helpful feature. Is there any way to get the arrows back? The screenshot shows how TB looks in Windows 10. That's exactly what I want the scroll bars to look like.

I'm using Thunderbird 140.4.0esr (64-bit) on Linux (Zorin Pro 17) on a Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Carbon.

Thanks a lot, DD

title: Folder Names Displaying Incorrectly (English instead of Polish)
creator: szymon.cuw
content:
Dear Support Team,

I am writing to report an issue with the folder names in your program.

Although I have selected Polish as the primary language setting within the application, the names of system folders (such as Inbox, Sent Items, Drafts, etc.) are all displayed in English.

Crucially, on my original mailbox (accessible via webmail or other clients), these folder names are correctly displayed in Polish.

I have attempted to change these folder names manually within your application, but the changes do not persist, and the names revert back to English. There seems to be no other option within the app to correctly synchronize or change the display language for these folders to Polish.

Could you please investigate this issue and provide a solution to ensure the folder names are displayed in Polish, consistent with my language setting and original mailbox configuration?

Thank you for your time and assistance.

Sincerely, Szymon
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:144.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/144.0;ff_version:144.0.2;os:Windows 11

title: Unable to delete emails
creator: argosdex2
content:
Hello,

I manage several emails through Thunderbird, the default account is my own, this is the one I am having trouble with.

1) I can send and receive emails. (this is an imap server) 2) When I added the account to Thunderbird in account settings it created the following folders/icons: Inbox Drafts Sent Mail All Mail Junk Spam Trash (with the traditional trash icon) Then the following folders: Drafts Important Starred Trash (Which looks like a windows folder) - If I have a trash can, why do I need a trash folder, I didn't create it.

I cannot delete emails from "All Mail", every time I delete one it reappears and at this point it has well over 8,000 going back to 2022. Most of which I don't need to keep any more.

If I go to google's website and log into my account I cannot delete them either! They come right back.

It's as if Google and Thunderbird are not talking to each other.

3) I've already uninstalled Thunderbird and deleted all the files from /users/myname/appdata/roaming/ Thunderbird/Profiles, ran Ccleaner, rebooted, reinstalled Thunderbird and added my mailboxes and still have the problem..

4) I've also tried to run Thunderbird without addons to no avail.

5) My other emails do not display this kind of behavior, just the on that is set as default.

If anyone has come across this please tell me what I need to do.

Thanks very much in advance.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/142.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: University Email in Thunderbird
creator: schanzhn
content:
Hello everyone,

I want to log into my university-related email account with thunderbird, to have all my emails in one place, and to be able to send emails from my "official" student email. I'm stuck on entering my password, because to log into the account in a browser, one has to go via the institutional login of my uni (Uni Freiburg, Germany). So instead of assigning a specific password for that email account, it redirects you to the university-wide login page, uses your username and password that you access all other uni-services, and then directy you back to the email-account.

So if I enter the password that I would enter on the uni-wirde login page, it tells me it's wrong (i've of course quintuple-checked this).

Do you have any experience or are familiar with cases like this? Do you think it's possible at all to log into my uni-mail in thunderbird?

Thanks!

title: Carpetas locales que desaparecen
creator: suportmpi
content:
Hola, tengo Thunderbird desde hace mucho tiempo. Tengo varias cuentas y algunas carpetas en "Carpetas Locales". El echo es que alguna carpeta de "Carpetas Locales" me desaparece, no se muestra. Para recuperarla, creo una carpeta nueva y una subcarpeta dentro del Thunderbird, cierro Thunderbird, entro en ...\Appdata\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\<nombre del perfil>\Mail\Local folders\ y muevo los dos archivos con el nombre de la carpeta desaparecida (que si se encuentra en su ubicación) a la nueva carpeta creada. Entonces si me aparece en el Thunderbird.

Me gustaria encontrar una solucion, ya que tengo una organización en Carpetas Locales bastante extensa y podria ser que haya perdido otra carpeta sin darme cuenta. Gracias!!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
